snippet: Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly, in an interview with Playboy magazine, said the candidates were “pandering” when they criticized the Police Department, particularly its stop-and-frisk tactics.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly says he resents criticism received from Democratic mayoral candidates during campaign season, accusing candidates of 'pandering' for votes by disparaging police department, particularly its stop-and-frisk policies.
lead_paragraph: Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly, in an interview with Playboy magazine, said the candidates were “pandering” when they criticized the Police Department, particularly its stop-and-frisk tactics.

headline.main: Kelly Attacks Mayoral Candidates for Criticizing Police Dept.
headline.print_headline: Kelly Attacks Candidates For Criticizing Police Dept.
